dc:description:
NEUROD1 was first reported in relation to autosomal dominant monogenic diabetes in 1999 (Malecki et al., PMID: 10545951). At least 14 variants (missense, nonsense, frameshift) have been reported in humans. Evidence supporting this gene-disease relationship includes limited case-level data, segregation data, and experimental data. Variants in this gene have been reported in at least 19 probands in 10 publications (PMIDs: 25041077, 28664602, 31216263, 11719843, 17440689, 31595705, 31578821, 10545951, 28095440, 18331410).  However, many of the reported variants are considered by the EP to have a frequency too high for MODY.  Additionally, the observed truncation variants are not true null variants as they are in a region not expected to undergo nonsense-mediated decay.  For the rare variants reported, there is a lack of sufficient evidence to attribute causality.  Additionally, the p.His206ProfsTer38 variant is technically problematic and failed random forests filtering in gnomAD exomes.  A variant (p.Glu110Lys) in this gene segregated with disease in 12 additional family members in well-characterized MODY family (PMID 11719843). Summary of case-level and segregation data:  0.9 points.  This gene-disease relationship is supported by functional assays, expression studies, and animal models. BETA2 (encoded by NEUROD1) was shown to heterodimerize with the ubiquitous helix-loop-helix (HLH) protein E47 and then bind the INS gene promotor to regulate its transcription through yeast two-hybrid assays and transient transfection assays in HIT cells to measure transcriptional activity (PMID: 7774807). Mice homozygous for disruption of BETA2 developed hyperglycemia by 2 days of age with ketonuria, suggesting severe diabetes and insulin deficiency, with abnormal pancreatic islet morphology, reduction in insulin producing cells, and lack of mature (PMID: 9308961). NEUROD1 expression has been confirmed in pancreatic tissue (PMID: 24309898). Summary of experimental evidence:  3.0 points.  In summary, there is limited evidence to support this gene-disease relationship.

Of note, this gene has also been implicated in autosomal recessive monogenic diabetes (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MONDO_0015967), which has been assessed separately.

evidence.dc:description: Mice homozygous for disruption of BETA2 developed hyperglycemia by 2 days of age with ketonuria, suggesting severe diabetes and insulin deficiency. These mice had abnormal pancreatic islet morphology with reduction in insulin producing cells and lack of mature islets (Fig. 2). Islet morphogenesis was arrested between E14.5-E17.5 (Table 1).

Mice homozygous for disruption of BETA2 developed hyperglycemia by 2 days of age with ketonuria, suggesting severe diabetes and insulin deficiency. These mice had abnormal pancreatic islet morphology with reduction in insulin producing cells and lack of mature islets (Fig. 2). Islet morphogenesis was arrested between E14.5-E17.5 (Table 1).
evidence.rdfs:label: NEUROD1 Mouse Model

evidence.dc:description: Per expert panel review: absent from gnomAD but only reported in GDM case

Per expert panel review: Truncation variants are not predicted to undergo NMD and therefore not null variants but to remove a substantial portion of the TA domain; Variant absent from gnomAD; score left at default due to lack of functional evidence

Per expert panel review: Truncation variants are not predicted to undergo NMD and therefore not null variants but to remove a substantial portion of the TA domain; Variant absent from gnomAD; score left at default due to lack of functional evidence

evidence.rdfs:label: Family A
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Clinically defined MODY, all have history of diabetes in at least 2 consecutive generations of their families, BMI = 23.3 (19.8–30) kg/m^2, fasting blood glucose = 7.5 (6.5–9.5) mmol/L, HbA1c = 6.8 (5.7–9.1)%, total serum cholesterol = 5.2 (4.5–5.4) mmol/L, HDL serum cholesterol = 1.1 (0.8–1.2) mmol/L

evidence.rdfs:label: Family 3
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: mother (I-2) diagnosed with diabetes at 42yo with proliferative retinopathy and nephropathy of the fourth stage, she also had intellectual disability and diffuse brain atrophy - died at 58yo from brain stem hemorrhage - did not have genetic testing

evidence.rdfs:label: M30 Family
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: age of onset of diabetes varied from 35 to 55 years; paternal relatives were obese with a BMI more than 30 kg/m2, maternal relatives with a normal BMI had earlier age of onset (<40 years) and needed insulin within 5–10 years of diagnosis

evidence.rdfs:label: Family 4
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: proband's mother (I-2) diagnosed with diabetes at 27yo - diagnosed with diabetes at 33yo

evidence.rdfs:label: Family B
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Clinically defined MODY, all have history of diabetes in at least 2 consecutive generations of their families, BMI = 23.3 (19.8–30) kg/m^2, fasting blood glucose = 7.5 (6.5–9.5) mmol/L, HbA1c = 6.8 (5.7–9.1)%, total serum cholesterol = 5.2 (4.5–5.4) mmol/L, HDL serum cholesterol = 1.1 (0.8–1.2) mmol/L

evidence.dc:description: Requires expert review due to diagnosis of Type II Diabetes and presence of abnormal segregations: Individual II-7 was absent for variant but had impaired glucose tolerance; Individual III-11 had type 2 diabetes but was absent for variant - reported to most likely be phenocopies
evidence.rdfs:label: Family A
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: high fasting serum insulin levels (C-peptide in individuals treated with insulin), high levels 2hr after oral glucose - stated to be "typical" patients of type 2 diabetes with onset in middle age; non-carriers were equally obese

evidence.rdfs:label: M26 Family
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: variable onset of diabetes from 38 to 50 years of age; absence of beta-cell autoimmunity, and diabetic ketoacidosis. Average BMI = 25 ± 5.8 kg/m2

evidence.dc:description: pLOD: 2.0; at marker D2S364 on chromosome 2 in region of NEUROD1
evidence.rdfs:label: Family 1

member.rdfs:label: Family 1 Proband (V-1)
member.detectionMethod: Linkage analysis using 39 microsatellite markers on 9 chromosomes; sequencing of NEUROD1 gene (PCR and direct sequencing of exon 2)
member.phenotypeFreeText: mean age of diabetes onset = 33 years (5 diagnosed before 25yo), mean BMI = 24.1kg/m2, only 1 individual was obese, 3 individuals had retinopathy, 5 individuals had peripheral neuropathy, 2 individuals had nephropathy

evidence.phenotypeFreeText: mean age of diabetes onset = 33 years (5 diagnosed before 25yo), mean BMI = 24.1kg/m2, only 1 individual was obese, 3 individuals had retinopathy, 5 individuals had peripheral neuropathy, 2 individuals had nephropathy

evidence.rdfs:label: Family 1

member.rdfs:label: Case 1
member.detectionMethod: Direct sequencing of all exons and flanking regions of NEUROD1; MLPA
member.phenotypeFreeText: treated by oral hypoglycemia agent alpha glucosidase inhibitor, insulin therapy 53 units / day, negative for autoantibodies, insulin secretory capacity was somewhat reduced at glucagon load examination

evidence.phenotypeFreeText: proband's mother (II-2) diagnosed with gestational diabetes at 31yo - diagnosed with diabetes at 42yo; grandfather of the proband (I-1) diagnosed with diabetes at 76yo

evidence.rdfs:label: Santana NEUROD1 Family

member.rdfs:label: Santana proband
member.detectionMethod: NGS (HNF4A, GCK, HNF1A, PDX1, HNF1B, NEUROD1, CEL, INS, ABCC8, KCNJ11, and APPL1)
member.phenotypeFreeText: normal weight, positive family history of diabetes, treated with Sulfonylurea, fasting plasma glucose = 137mg/dL, range of AIC = 6.1–10.0%, C-peptide =1.6ng/mL
member.previousTestingDescription: negative prior genetic analysis (Sanger sequencing or MLPA)

evidence.phenotypeFreeText: median fasting plasma glucose = 131mg/dL, median A1C = 7.5%, median Glucose tolerance test (GTT) increment = 109mg/dL, median Fasting C‐peptide = 1.7ng/mL

evidence.rdfs:label: Abreu Family

member.rdfs:label: Abreu proband
member.phenotypeFreeText: weight loss of approximately 10 kg at diagnosis (BMI at diagnostic: 28.9 kg/m2), mean fasting glucose of 137 mg/dl, glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c‐HPLC) of 7.5% (HbA1c at diagnosis: 6.5%), treated with metformin and insulin; comorbidity - hypertension
member.previousTestingDescription: negative for GCK or HNF1A, HNF4A, and HNF1B mutations

evidence.phenotypeFreeText: proband's mother (I-2) diagnosed with diabetes at 23yo - treated with insulin, developed diabetic retinopathy and nephropathy; proband's sister (II-3) diagnosed with accidental hyperglycemia at 26yo - treated with insulin; age at onset ≤35 years, BMI <30 kg/m2 or 95th percentile at the diagnosis, positive family history of diabetes in at least two generations, negative for GAD and IA2 autoantibodies

evidence.rdfs:label: Family 2

member.rdfs:label: Case 2
member.detectionMethod: Direct sequencing of all exons and flanking regions of NEUROD1; MLPA
member.phenotypeFreeText: treated with insulin (3 units/day), negative for autoantibodies, low hairline, bilateral brachydactylia of the 5th digit, bilateral incomplete dactylsymphysis of the 3rd and 4th digit, poor finger to nose test on left side, IQ = 70, brain MRI at 19yo showed dysplasia of right hippocampus but no abnormality of cerebellum

evidence.phenotypeFreeText: probands mother (I-2) had gestational diabetes at 34yo which developed into overt diabetes with diabetic nephropathy and retinopathy - she died at 55 due to renal insufficiency and heart failure, she also had mild intellectual disability and deformities similar to the proband's

evidence.rdfs:label: Liu Family
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Diagnosis of type II diabetes, but family meets criteria for MODY; proband's father (II-4) diagnosed at 61yo and treated with OHA; early onset diabetes (<40yo), BMI, 24.3 ± 4.6 kg/m2, diabetes was linearly transmitted from the first-degree relatives through two to four generations, 8 families of these patients met minimal criteria for MODY: two consecutive generations of type 2 diabetes with at least one member diagnosed at ≤25 years of age, at least three members were affected, negative for GAD and IA2 antibodies

evidence.dc:description: Requires expert review due to diagnosis of Type II Diabetes and presence of abnormal segregations: 2 individuals (III-7 and III-13), were unaffected, but heterozygous for variant - reported to be non-penetrants; patients of this family stated to resemble MODY phenotype of HNF1a variant carriers
evidence.rdfs:label: Family B

member.rdfs:label: Family B - II-5
member.detectionMethod: Direct sequencing of exon 2 and flanking intron sequences
member.phenotypeFreeText: treated with insulin - low serum insulin levels; those treated with insulin had undetectable C-peptide - absence of endogenous insulin secretion

evidence.phenotypeFreeText: low serum insulin levels; those treated with insulin had undetectable C-peptide - absence of endogenous insulin secretion
